full_threads.body:
Hello,

For example

Richard Schneider received order number 7073 which is being reflected in our PayPal account



However, his order is being sent to us under number 5780 therefore the order in PayPal is not matching the file shared with our IT and they are all being manually reconciled by customer details which is not ideal.

Can you please look into this?

Thanks

Bonnie​​​​ Sudirwan

Marketing Communications Manager





bsudirwan@mayohardware.com.au



http://www.mayohardware.com.au/



+61 0408331966



Customer Service: 1300 360 211

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Bonnie,

Jumping in here to help. In response to your questions.

  1. We have matched up the order number, so moving forward, these will match in the website and pronto (they are running a plugin that was causing the issue.
  2. Do you have a Secure Pay account? If not, it may be the previous owner's Secure Pay account. We can turn off that payment option as an immediate action pending your approval?
  3. GST appears to be being charged and itemised. Do you have a specific example I can review where you think it was not?

Hi Joel,

We have also just discovered that customers aren't being charged GST

So 3 issues:


  1. Customers are receiving a different inv number

  2. Payments paid via securepay are not coming through to us

  3. Customers aren't being charged GST when the payment is processed



Thanks

Bonnie​​​​ Sudirwan

Marketing Communications Manager





bsudirwan@mayohardware.com.au



http://www.mayohardware.com.au/



+61 0408331966
